verses.kjv: And Rehoboam went to Shechem: for to Shechem were all Israel come to make him king.
verses.ct: Rehoboam traveled to Shechem, because all of Israel had gathered there to make him king.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who was in Egypt, whither he had fled from the presence of Solomon the king, heard it, that Jeroboam returned out of Egypt.
verses.ct: When Jeroboam son of Nebat heard about this — he was still in Egypt, where he had fled to escape King Solomon — he came back from Egypt.

verses.kjv: And they sent and called him. So Jeroboam and all Israel came and spake to Rehoboam, saying,
verses.ct: The people sent for him and invited him to come. So Jeroboam and all of Israel went to Rehoboam and said to him,

verses.kjv: Thy father made our yoke grievous: now therefore ease thou somewhat the grievous servitude of thy father, and his heavy yoke that he put upon us, and we will serve thee.
verses.ct: "Your father placed a crushing burden on us. If you lighten the harsh labor and the heavy load your father imposed on us, we will serve you."

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Come again unto me after three days. And the people departed.
verses.ct: Rehoboam told them, "Come back to me in 3 days." So the people left.

verses.kjv: And king Rehoboam took counsel with the old men that had stood before Solomon his father while he yet lived, saying, What counsel give ye me to return answer to this people?
verses.ct: King Rehoboam consulted the older advisors who had served his father Solomon during his lifetime. He asked them, "What do you recommend I say in response to these people?"

verses.kjv: And they spake unto him, saying, If thou be kind to this people, and please them, and speak good words to them, they will be thy servants for ever.
verses.ct: They told him, "If you treat these people with kindness, make them happy, and speak encouraging words to them, they will serve you forever."

verses.kjv: But he forsook the counsel which the old men gave him, and took counsel with the young men that were brought up with him, that stood before him.
verses.ct: But he rejected the advice the older men gave him and instead consulted the young men who had grown up with him and now served as his attendants.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, What advice give ye that we may return answer to this people, which have spoken to me, saying, Ease somewhat the yoke that thy father did put upon us?
verses.ct: He asked them, "What do you suggest we say to these people who have asked me, 'Lighten the burden your father placed on us'?"

verses.kjv: And the young men that were brought up with him spake unto him, saying, Thus shalt thou answer the people that spake unto thee, saying, Thy father made our yoke heavy, but make thou it somewhat lighter for us; thus shalt thou say unto them, My little finger shall be thicker than my father’s loins.
verses.ct: The young men who had grown up with him replied, "Here's what you should tell the people who said, 'Your father made our burden heavy, so make it lighter for us.' Say this to them: 'My little finger is thicker than my father's waist.'

verses.kjv: For whereas my father put a heavy yoke upon you, I will put more to your yoke: my father chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with scorpions.
verses.ct: "'If my father loaded you down with a heavy burden, I will make it even heavier. My father disciplined you with whips, but I will discipline you with barbed lashes.'"

verses.kjv: So Jeroboam and all the people came to Rehoboam on the third day, as the king bade, saying, Come again to me on the third day.
verses.ct: So Jeroboam and all the people came back to Rehoboam on the 3rd day, just as the king had instructed when he said, "Come back to me on the 3rd day."

verses.kjv: And the king answered them roughly; and king Rehoboam forsook the counsel of the old men,
verses.ct: The king responded to them harshly. King Rehoboam rejected the advice of the older men

verses.kjv: And answered them after the advice of the young men, saying, My father made your yoke heavy, but I will add thereto: my father chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with scorpions.
verses.ct: and followed the recommendation of the young men instead. He said, "My father made your burden heavy, and I will make it even heavier. My father disciplined you with whips, but I will discipline you with barbed lashes."

verses.kjv: So the king hearkened not unto the people: for the cause was of God, that the LORD might perform his word, which he spake by the hand of Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam the son of Nebat.
verses.ct: So the king refused to listen to the people. This turn of events was directed by God so that the LORD would fulfill what he had spoken through Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam son of Nebat.

verses.kjv: And when all Israel saw that the king would not hearken unto them, the people answered the king, saying, What portion have we in David? and we have none inheritance in the son of Jesse: every man to your tents, O Israel: and now, David, see to thine own house. So all Israel went to their tents.
verses.ct: When all of Israel realized that the king would not listen to them, the people answered the king: "What connection do we have to David? We have no stake in the son of Jesse! Everyone go home, Israel! David, take care of your own house!" So all of Israel went home.

verses.kjv: But as for the children of Israel that dwelt in the cities of Judah, Rehoboam reigned over them.
verses.ct: However, Rehoboam still ruled over the Israelites who lived in the towns of Judah.

verses.kjv: Then king Rehoboam sent Hadoram that was over the tribute; and the children of Israel stoned him with stones, that he died. But king Rehoboam made speed to get him up to his chariot, to flee to Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Then King Rehoboam sent out Hadoram, who was in charge of the forced labor, but the Israelites pelted him with stones until he died. King Rehoboam quickly jumped into his chariot and escaped to Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And Israel rebelled against the house of David unto this day.
verses.ct: Israel has been in rebellion against the house of David to this day.
